name: Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery (2025)
summary: This is EVERYTHING I look for in a movie. So, so, so, so good.
pros: Eccentric Daniel Craig acting is excellent yet again.
Father Jud's character was actually written super well; was actually invested in him.
No "cheap"ness in the twists and turns. Actual smartness.
Editing work is fantastic, movie flows super smooth. This is a TIGHT movie.
I loved the camera work. Those parfocal zoom shots in particular.
Super good story. I was locked-in right from the first scene.
The "good Christianity" part is actually done so well. Made me emotional about the scene with Father Jud with Louis on call.
The Christian themes reminded me of Dan Brown novels. God do I love those.
cons: This movie should perhaps have been 15 mins longer, making some hints a bit more obvious to dumb viewers like me.
Maybe a minor plot hole - why did the biopsy (assuming it was done) not reveal the tranquilizer?
